posts.name: Ruhmit Sahu
posts.cooked: Hi! I’ve been trying to figure out why our auto is delayed by about 6 seconds before pathplanner loads the auto, I checked in advantage scope and I can see that the odometry doesn’t get reset to the auto pose until about halfway through the autonomous period, I’m running AutoBuilder in RobotContainer and the delay doesn’t occur in simulation so I’m not sure why it’s so long on robot. I know this is similar to this topic but the solution for them was running autobuilder in the robotcontainer constructor which I’m already doing, so any help would be appreciated!

link_counts.title: Noticeable Delay Between Start of Autonomous and Robot Motion

posts.name: Ian McTavish
posts.cooked: Have you checked if your camera is still connecting when auto starts?

posts.cooked:

link_counts.title: PathPlanner first path going insane - HELP!

posts.name: Technologyman00
posts.cooked:
https://pathplanner.dev/pplib-pathfinding.html#java-warmup

If you are using Java make sure you run the warmup on boot

posts.name: Bryan Herbst
posts.cooked:
We recently tracked down a roughly 6 second loop overrun to a constants file that contained an enum with 4 different values that each loaded a different AprilTagFieldLayout JSON file.

File I/O is not cheap. The other lesson here was about how Java class loading works and the fact that this initialization happens when we first access that constants file.

posts.name: Ruhmit Sahu
posts.cooked: This did help significantly, I was trying to remember what this command was called, delay is down to about 2 seconds!
